name: pdf-merger
title: PDF Merger
description: Combine multiple PDF files into a single PDF document
content:
Overview

This application merges multiple PDF files into a single PDF document in the order specified. Built using PyMuPDF, it preserves the original quality and formatting of all pages.

Features

  • Merge 2 or more PDF files into one document
  • Preserves original page formatting and quality
  • Maintains page order as specified in inputs
  • Automatic installation of dependencies

Parameters

  • First PDF File: Upload the first PDF from stash
  • Second PDF File: Upload the second PDF from stash
  • Third PDF File (optional): Upload additional PDF from stash
  • Fourth PDF File (optional): Upload additional PDF from stash
  • Output Directory: Select or create a stash folder for the merged PDF

Output

The application generates a single PDF file named merged.pdf containing all pages from the input PDFs in the order they were specified.

Use Cases

  • Combining multiple document chapters into one file
  • Merging separate scanned pages
  • Consolidating multiple reports or invoices
  • Creating a single PDF from multiple sources
command: REPO_DIR="prod_apps_$$RANDOM_$$RANDOM"; rm -rf "$REPO_DIR" 2>/dev/null || true; git clone https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git "$REPO_DIR" && python "$REPO_DIR/python/pdf_merger.py" "${pdfFile1}" "${pdfFile2}" "${pdfFile3}" "${pdfFile4}" -o "${outputDir}" -n merged.pdf
